summary: If your stamina goes down to zero and you try to run, you fall.
descriptionHtml:
[color=#ff0000][u][size=4][b][color=#ff7700]TL;DR[/color]
[/b][/size][size=4][b]
[/b][/size][/u][/color][size=3]If your Stamina drops to Zero, and you try to Run, you Ragdoll. You can still walk, though.


[/size][color=#ff7700][size=4][u][b]Long Description

[/b][/u][/size][/color][size=3]Like most of Skyrim players, I've been going for immersion since ever.
Even with many immersion mods, I never felt too "punished" when depleting the character's stamina. Even with mods that adds heavy breathing or blurred vision, it never bothered too much.

This simple mod changes that.
If your Stamina drops to Zero, AND you try to run, the character will Ragdoll and not gently fall on its face.
You can still walk, though. (Useful on those situations when your stamina is stuck on zero, due to disease or other effects)

Seems simple, but changes everything.
You will have to better keep track of your stamina in combat.
It becomes VERY hard to outrun pursuers now, specially on early game. (Don't go outside on your own!)
And swimming becomes quite dangerous too, you'll float adrift if you're not careful. (At first, I turned off the function when swimming, but it's not half as fun, and becomes an exploitable feature)

[color=#ff7700][size=4][u][b]Mod Activation

[/b][/u][/size][/color]1) Download the Mod;
2) Drop it on your Skyrim/Data folder;
3) Activate it, and play the game;
4) To activate the Effect, you have to find and read the Book [b]"Exhaustion Management for Dummies"[/b]. It can be found on a barrel, by the side of the Sleeping Giant Inn, Riverwood;
5) Alternatively, you can add manually the Book via console;

[/size][size=3][color=#ff7700][b]Compatibility
[/b][/color]It's so ridiculously simple that should work with anything else. No need even for DLCs, I guess.
Mods that change the appearance of Riverwood may screw with the book location, forcing you to add it manually via console.[/size]

[size=3][color=#ff7700][b]Suggested mods
[/b][/color]It should go well with any stamina draining mods.

I'm currently using:
http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59742/?


It's the first mod I've built my own effects, so if you find any problems, feel free to report!

Thanks, folks![/size]
author: InertRen
